etymology.description: 羊(羊) (yáng, "sheep") + 大(大) (dà, "big") = a big sheep, which was seen as beautiful and auspicious -> beautiful
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 羊(羊) (yáng, "sheep") and 大(大) (dà, "big") reflects the cultural value of sheep as symbols of beauty and prosperity in ancient China. A large sheep was particularly prized, leading to the association with beauty.

examples.chinese: 这个景色很美(這個景色很美)。
她的笑容美极了(她的笑容美極了)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de xiàoróng měi jí le.

examples.chinese: 夜晚来临时(夜晚來臨時)，月光无限美(月光無限美)。
examples.pinyin: Yèwǎn láilín shí, yuèguāng wúxiàn měi.
examples.english: When night falls, the moonlight is infinitely beautiful.
